questions.text: Delusion of grandiosity is seen in all, except? (JIPMER MAY 19)
All of the following are correct with respect to different grades of insight, except? (AIIMS MAY 19)

options.label: A
options.text: Grade III : Patient is aware of his illness, but blames it on others or external factors

options.label: B
options.text: Grade II : Slight awareness of being sick and needing help but denying it at the same time

options.label: C
options.text: Grade IV : Emotional awareness of the motives and feelings within, of the underlying meaning of symptoms

options.label: D
options.text: Grade I : Complete denial of illness

questions.correct_answer: C. Grade IV : Emotional awareness of the motives and feelings within, of the underlying meaning of symptoms

questions.text: SEQUENTIAL ARRANGEMENT (AIIMS NEW PATTERN) Arrange the following stages of mania in order of appearance and severity… 1. Elation 2. Ecstasy 3. Euphoria 4. Exaltation
MATCH THE FOLLOWING (AIIMS NEW PATTERN) Match the following diagnosis with minimum duration needed for treatment (as per DSM 5)
“Match box” sign is seen in? (PGI MAY 19)
Lobe atrophied in chronic schizophrenia? (JIPMER MAY 19)
Which of the following is schizophrenic first rank symptom? (JIPMER DEC 19)

Arnab is a model patient on the ward. He is never in any trouble. Whatever he is told to do he does. He sits quietly for hours, rarely talking, and hardly moving, except to ape the movements of those who pass by him. The most likely diagnosis for Arnab is
A schizophrenia patient on Haloperidol shows improvement in positive symptoms but develops akathisia and dystonia. Which drug can be beneficial the most in this patient? (JIPMER DEC 19)

EXTENDED MATCHING TYPE QUESTION (AIIMS NEW PATTERN), Match the given case scenarios with the most appropriate diagnosis from given options. “THEME: Psychotic symptoms” A 39-year-old woman comes to the physician accompanied by her husband. He says that for the past 3 months she has refused to eat any food that is not prepackaged. The patient also has placed a lock on the cabinet where she keeps her food and refuses to go to restaurants or eat at social events unless there is unopened, prepackaged food available. Otherwise, she is her normal self. She continues to work and recently received a promotion. The patient believes that someone is coming into her home and poisoning her food. A few months ago, she noticed a tiny hole in an apple at home and was convinced that someone had injected it with poison. She has no past psychiatric history. Except for these beliefs, her mental status examination is normal. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis in this patient?

EXTENDED MATCHING TYPE QUESTION (AIIMS NEW PATTERN), Match the given case scenarios with the most appropriate diagnosis from given options. “THEME: Psychotic symptoms” A 15-year -old boy is brought to the pediatrician due to his bizarre behavior. His mother has found him whispering to himself at night on multiple occasions over the past 2 months. When questioned, he told her that he was "talking with aliens from outer space" and insisted that the aliens were "transmitting thoughts from my brain to their planet." During this period, the boy has become more withdrawn and his school grades have steadily declined. He refuses to make eye contact and replies only in monosyllables. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis in this patient?

A 24-year-old man is brought to your emergency department under arrest by the local police. The patient was found naked at a busy intersection jumping up and down on top of a car. Interviewing the patient, you discover that he has not slept in 2 days because he does not feel tired. He reports hearing voices. The patient was previously hospitalized 1 year ago with auditory hallucinations, paranoia, and a normal mood. What is the most likely diagnosis?
Paradoxical suicide is seen in: (AIIMS MAY 19)

options.label: A
options.text: Suicide after taking low dose of drug

options.label: B
options.text: Suicide occurring at the time when the patient starts to recover

questions.correct_answer: B. Suicide occurring at the time when the patient starts to recover

questions.text: A 60-years-old man whose wife died 3 months back now starts to believe that his intestines have rotten away and that he is responsible for the death of his wife and should be sent to prison. The most likely diagnosis is:
Which of the following features seen in a 12 y old child suffering from depression is not suggestive of development of bipolar disorder later? (JIPMER MAY 19)

Mr. X was treated by a doctor for his sad mood and suicidal ideas and while doing so therapist is asking for his negative thoughts, worthlessness and tries to correct it. Which type of psychotherapy is she giving? (NIMHANS 19)
Which of the following is correctly matched adequate antidepressant dose? (JIPMER DEC 19)
Which of the following statement is true about “cyclothymia”? (NIMHANS OCT 19)

options.label: A
options.text: Should definitely have an episode of severe depression

options.label: C
options.text: Should definitely have an episode of mania

options.label: D
options.text: Should have major periods of hypomania

questions.correct_answer: B. Minimum duration to diagnose is 2yrs

questions.text: A 28-year-old man comes to the physician complaining that he is "just not feeling like myself." This feeling began soon after his younger brother passed away from cancer 3 months ago. The patient is no longer interested in work or going out with friends on weekends. He falls asleep relatively easily at night but awakes very early in the morning and is unable to fall back asleep. He admits to feeling "down in the dumps," especially when he first wakes up but says that his mood improves a little during the day. The patient often thinks about ways that he could have spent more time with his brother. He feels guilty about his brother's death being his fault "because I am worthless and could not love him enough." His poor energy and concentration have started to affect his performance at work, and he frequently thinks that he should just quit "because I am bringing everyone down." The patient has been eating less and has lost 3 kgs over the past few weeks. What is this patient's most likely diagnosis?
Which of the following is not true regarding depersonalization? (AIIMS MAY 19)

options.label: A
options.text: More common after life threatening trauma

options.label: B
options.text: Can be seen in seizure and migraine patients

options.label: C
options.text: More common in females then males

questions.text: For 3 weeks following an automobile accident where she watched her child die, a 28-year-old woman reports difficulty sleeping, headaches, and an inability to concentrate. Her family reports that she suffers from nightmares and violent emotional outbursts when awake. Since the accident, she refuses to either drive or ride in a car. The symptoms presented here are most consistent with a diagnosis of
Which of the following defense mechanisms is not involved in psychodynamics of OCD? (JIPMER DEC 19)

EXTENDED MATCHING TYPE QUESTION, Match the given case scenarios with the most appropriate diagnosis from given options. “THEME: Anxiety symptoms” An 18-year-old female has just started college and is living by herself for the first time. For the past month, she has been increasingly anxious that someone is going to break into her house despite living in a quiet neighbourhood. She feels tense all of the time and is having difficulty sleeping through the night. As a result, she feels tired all day, which is beginning to affect her studies.

EXTENDED MATCHING TYPE QUESTION, Match the given case scenarios with the most appropriate diagnosis from given options. “THEME: Anxiety symptoms” A 33-year -old woman reports worsening anxiety over the past eight months, beginning around the time she started a new job. She is having a difficult time concentrating because she keeps wondering if her children are safe at school. She also finds herself making mental lists of the things she has to do to prepare for a party she is having at her home next month. By the time she gets home, she feels exhausted and often snaps at her children and husband. During the night, she has a difficult time falling asleep and constantly worries about getting everything done at work. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A 41 -year-old woman agrees to talk with her physician at her husband's insistence. She says, "I've always had trouble throwing things away, especially magazines, newspapers, books, old clothes, and lots of miscellaneous household items." She thinks she may need the items again or wonders if discarded items may increase in value. Her husband is concerned that the large piles in their house continue to grow, making it difficult to move around or find a place to sit. The patient's family is embarrassed by her actions and refuses to have relatives or friends over to visit. She has attempted to clean rooms or throw things away on many occasions but always becomes anxious at the thought of parting with various items. She feels guilty and sometimes cries when considering the toll on her family. The patient has no problems with sleep, appetite, concentration, or motivation. In addition to recommending cognitive behavioral therapy, what is the most appropriate initial treatment approach?

An elderly patient, known to suffer from dementia, was found walking aimlessly in the fields in hot weather for several hours before being brought to the clinic. Which of the following would be the most useful laboratory test? (similar to PGI NOV 19)
Visual hallucinations are most predominantly seen in (AIIMS MAY 19)
A 38 year old male, known alcoholic, iv drug user, memory loss in last 6 months, motor incoordination, movement problems, confusion, brain shows cortical atrophy? (JIPMER DEC 19)
In an alcoholic patient, which of the following causes “DELIRIUM TREMENS”? (AIIMS NOV 19)
Which of the following is not true regarding narcolepsy? (JIPMER DEC 19)

options.label: A
options.text: Related gene on 6th chromosome MHC 2 HLA DR 2

options.label: B
options.text: Hyperactivity of orexin releasing neurons in hypothalamus

options.label: C
options.text: Inability of brain to regulate sleep wake cycle

questions.correct_answer: B. Hyperactivity of orexin releasing neurons in hypothalamus

questions.text: A childhood friend makes a visit to your office. The last time you saw her was at her wedding one year ago. As the conversation proceeds, you ask her casually if married life is treating her well. She suddenly bursts into tears and admits that her husband is physically abusive, but that she can't leave him because she is deeply afraid of being alone. Going back to childhood, this woman has always had her parents make decisions for her, including those regarding her education and career. She has always been very pleasant and courteous in her dealings with others, and avoids arguments or disagreements whenever possible. Which of the following personality disorders does this woman most likely suffer from?

options.label: C
options.text: Schizot y pal personali ty disorder

options.label: D
options.text: A v oidant personalit y disorder

questions.explanation:
Explanation:

  • • In this scenario , the friend's indecisi v eness , inabili ty to disagree w ith others , and w illingness to sta y in an abusi v e relationship for fear of being left alone are suggesti v e of dependent personali ty disorder. Indi v iduals w ith this condition tend to be cling y and submissi v e , and cra v e the protection and care of others . The y a v oid taking the initiati v e because of feelings of inadequac y .
  • • (Choice A ) Schizoid personali ty disorder is characterized b y an inabili ty to e x press emotion and social detachment. These patients do not enjo y close relationships and prefer to be aloof and isolated . The y rarel y indulge in an y pleasurable acti v ities and appear indifferent to praise or criticism from others .
  • • (Choice C) Schizo ty pal personali ty disorder is characterized b y a pattern of odd and e cc entric beha v ior and a redu c ed capaci ty for close relationships . These patients usuall y e x hibit " magical thinking . " The y ma y ha v e bizarre fantasies or belie v e in telepath y , clairvo y ance , or the concept of a sixth sense . The y often ha v e paranoid ideation and unusual perceptual e x periences .
  • • (Choice D ) A v oidant personali ty disorder is characterized b y h y persensiti v i ty to criticism , social inhibition , and feelings of inadequac y . Although these indi v iduals w ant friendships , the y a v oid ( as the name suggests ) such intimate relationships be c ause the y fear ridicule . The y also percei v e themsel v es as inferior to others and are reluctant to engage in ne w acti v ities or to take risks for fear of being embarrassed . Although the y appear sh y , indi v iduals w ith this condit i on actuall y w ant to make friends .

questions.text: A young girl with anorexia nervosa is on treatment. Even after taking adequate food according to the recommended diet plan for last 1 week, there is no gain of weight. What is the next step in management? (AIIMS NOV 19)

options.label: B
options.text: Observe the patient for 2 hours after giving meal

options.label: D
options.text: Increase the caloric intake from 1500 kcal to 2000 kcal per day

questions.correct_answer: B. Observe the patient for 2 hours after giving meal

questions.text: Which of the following is not true about anorexia nervosa? (JIPMER MAY 19)

options.label: A
options.text: Anorexia nervosa has the highest mortality amongst all mental disorders

options.label: B
options.text: According to DSM-5, Weight less than 85 percent of expected and BMI<17.5 are a part of diagnostic criteria

options.label: C
options.text: Acc. to DSM-5, diagnosis is clinical and severity is based on BMI values

options.label: D
options.text: Patient may or may not verbally tell about self-perception of being fat

questions.correct_answer: B. According to DSM-5, Weight less than 85 percent of expected and BMI<17.5 are a part of diagnostic criteria

questions.text: Features of AUTISM SPECTRUM DISORDER are all except? (PGI MAY 19)///

SEQUENTIAL ARRANGEMENT (AIIMS NEW PATTERN) Arrange the following symptoms of ADHD in order of their response to treatment (from earliest to last… 1. Acts before thinking, on the spur of the moment 2. Talks excessively 3. Doesn’t seem to listen
Clinical features of tourette’s syndrome? a. Grunting b. Excessive eye blinking c. Palilalia d. Echolalia

options.label: A
options.text: If a, b, c are correct

options.label: B
options.text: If a and c are correct

options.label: C
options.text: If b and d are correct

options.label: D
options.text: If all four (a, b, c, & d) are correct

questions.correct_answer: A. If a, b, c are correct

questions.text: A 48- y ear-old w oman notices a firm , fixed mass in her right breast but chooses not to seek medical care . The mass is then detected during her annual ph y sical examination 8 months later . B y that point , it has increased greatl y in size , causing her discomfort . W hen asked w h y she did not report the mass when she first noticed it , she sa y s , " I w as w aiting for m y children to graduate from high school. I didn't w ant to have a bunch of doctors' appointments w hen I should be helping them w ith their home w ork ." This response is an example of w hich of the follo w ing defense mechanisms?
AIIMS NEW PATTERN Assertion: “Ego” functions are based on reality principle. Reason: Ego maintains the balance between Id and Superego.

options.label: A
options.text: Both Assertion and Reasons are independently true / correct statements and the Reason is the correct explanation for the Assertion

options.label: B
options.text: Both Assertion and Reasons are independently true / correct statements, but the Reason is not the correct explanation for the Assertion

options.label: C
options.text: Assertion is independently a true / correct statement, but the Reasons is independently a false / incorrect statement

options.label: D
options.text: Assertion is independently a false / incorrect statement, but the Reasons is independently a true / correct statement

options.label: E
options.text: Both Assertion and Reasons are independently false / incorrect statements

questions.correct_answer: B. Both Assertion and Reasons are independently true / correct statements, but the Reason is not the correct explanation for the Assertion

questions.text: In a patient having alcohol withdrawal, with liver function tests abnormalities, which of the following benzodiazepines are safer? (PGI MAY 19)

Astacia abasia is seen in

Alcoholic Paranoia is associated with
Consultation - Liaison (C -L) psychiatry involves diagnosing -
questions.correct_answer: A. Psychiatric illness in medically ill

questions.text: A 48-year-old woman comes to a psychiatrist for help with the management of her obsessive-compulsive disorder. She describes a repetitive thought that frightens her. This worry is to harm the family members by accidently lighting a matchstick in kitchen in presence of gas knob on. As a result, she finds herself checking the gas knob in her home at least 30 times a day. Which of the following defense mechanisms does this act of checking represent?

After being struck on the head by an iron rod, a previously serious construction worker starts making inappropriate sexual remarks to his coworkers, is easily distracted, and loses his temper over minor provocations. What part of his brain has most likely been damaged?

A 45-year-old woman has thin legs and arms but a considerable amount of fat deposited on her abdomen, chest, and shoulders. Her skin is thin and atrophic and she has several purple striae on her abdomen. An MRI shows the presence of a pituitary adenoma. The psychiatric disorder most commonly associated with this syndrome is

A patient with schizophrenia has had a poor response to several trials of typical antipsychotic medications, risperidone and olanzapine. His psychiatrist recommends a trial of clozapine. What factor can represent a relative contraindication to the use of this medication?

options.label: A
options.text: A history of severe extrapyramidal symptoms while on haloperidol

options.label: B
options.text: The presence of mild tardive dyskinesia

options.label: C
options.text: A history of recurrent depressive symptoms

questions.text: A young man with a diagnosis of paranoid schizophrenia is hospitalized for the third time in the space of six months for acute exacerbations of his symptoms. He has been compliant with his antipsychotic medications and has kept his monthly doctor appointments. When his parents come to visit, they worry about the patient’s unkempt appearance and urge him to take better care of yourself. They show their disappointment when they learn that the patient has not participated in groups and has been spending most of his time in his room. Choose the most appropriate statement:

options.label: A
options.text: Schizophrenic patients do not need constant encouragement to stay motivated

options.label: B
options.text: Family style of interaction makes no difference in the prognosis

options.label: C
options.text: Intrusive and critical families have a detrimental effect on schizophrenic patients

options.label: D
options.text: Family therapy has not proved to be of value in the treatment of schizophrenia

questions.correct_answer: C. Intrusive and critical families have a detrimental effect on schizophrenic patients

A 30-year-old man comes to the emergency room with symptoms of tachycardia, diaphoresis, mydriasis, and hyperthermia. He also shows muscle twitching and clonus. His medications include a protease inhibitor and fluoxetine 20 mg daily which was started 1 week ago. Diagnosis?

A 36-year-old man is admitted to the hospital after a suicide attempt, in which he swallowed his entire bottle of lithium pills. In the emergency room, he is noted to be stuporous, with a lithium level of 4.5 meq/L. His urine output is noted to be less than one-half what would normally be expected for a patient of his age. Which of the following procedures should be performed next?

A 42-year-old man is diagnosed with a psychotic depression and is started on imipramine and perphenazine. When he develops a dystonia, he is begun on benztropine 2 mg/day. One week later, his wife reports that the patient has become unusually forgetful and seems disoriented at night. On physical examination, the man appears slightly flushed, his skin and palms are dry, and he is tachycardic. He is oriented to name and place only. He showed none of these symptoms during his last appointment. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?

questions.correct_answer: A. Change in neurotransmitter receptor sensitivity
